thread.title: Belvoir Federal Purchased School Supplies for Fort Belvoir Elementary School
thread.title_full: Belvoir Federal Purchased School Supplies for Fort Belvoir Elementary School - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Belvoir Federal Purchased School Supplies for Fort Belvoir Elementary School
text:
Belvoir Federal Credit Union purchased school supplies for Fort Belvoir Elementary School through employee donations.
Woodbridge, VA (PRWEB) October 08, 2015
Belvoir Federal Credit Union purchased school supplies for Fort Belvoir Elementary School through employee donations.
During Belvoir Federal’s Employee Appreciation Week, funds were collected as a 50/50 raffle with $200 going towards a local elementary school and the remaining balance going towards the lucky raffle winner.
Fort Belvoir Elementary School’s Principal, Theresa Carhart, asked that new clothing for a clothing closet be purchased for students rather than traditional school supplies. These resources would then be available for students who might need a change of clothes throughout the school day.
“Our school is thankful for Belvoir Federal and the partnership we have created. Belvoir Federal’s staff continues to go above and beyond in their support of our school, community, and students. Their most recent donation of items will help us when instances arise where students need a change of clothes,” stated Theresa Carhart.
Ms. Carhart shared that through this donation, they will be able to help students have necessary resources when emergencies arise, maximize instructional time, and minimize pulling parents away from their work to bring a change of clothes.
Fort Belvoir Elementary School
Fort Belvoir Elementary School, A Fairfax County Public School, opened its doors in September 1998. Located on the Fort Belvoir Army Installation, the school serves military-connected students in grades Pre-K-6, and has a program capacity of 1,102 students. The school replaced the three existing elementary schools (Cheney, Markham, and Barden) that closed in June 1998 and is one of the largest elementary schools within Fairfax County Public Schools (FCPS) and the Washington Metropolitan area. For more information, visit http://www.fcps.edu .
About Belvoir Federal Credit Union
Belvoir Federal is a member-owned, full-service financial institution that provides the foundation for the financial success of our Members. Belvoir Federal, a not-for-profit organization, has served the Fort Belvoir and U.S. Armed Forces community since 1946 and named 2014 and 2015 Best Places to Work in Virginia. For more information about Belvoir Federal, please visit http://www.BelvoirCreditUnion.org .
